subject: partitioning-parted: extraced and adapted element
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-08 17:59:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/281c5390e276791e7fae3c73a3a0ab4a3542c39b', 'message': "partitioning-parted: extraced and adapted element

Two ideas are behind this patch:
o factor out the code duplication of vm/block-device.d and
  partitioning-sfdisk/block-device.d.
  It looks that the later one is a copy&paste&adapt two lines
  of the former.
o Use parted which was already used in the vm/block-device.d as an
  alternative to sfdisk generating user-defined partition tables with
  more than one usable partition.

It was not possible to have only local changes, because of lot of
different elements making assumptions about the partition table, boot
partitions, name of the partitions - e.g. disk-image-create,
bootloader, debootstrap.

The aim was to be as compatible as possible: users of an older version
who does not use the new element should get the same result as
before.

Common used functions are implemented in the 'common-functions' or the
new 'partitioning-functions'.

The new implemented element and functions prepare using other ways of
providing disk space, e.g. using LVM.

In addition a bug in 'eval_run_d' was fixed that was triggered by the
changes.

Change-Id: Ib75a021e32fcb2b0a595bae8791f6768cd5babbd
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-13 21:09:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/73079490259b30ed8d7e639a580d17e0be6d3984', 'message': "partitioning-parted: extraced and adapted element

'elements/fedora/test-elements/build-succeeds/element-deps', 'elements/partitioning-parted/README.rst', 'elements/partitioning-parted/test-elements/three_primaries/check_test_result', 'elements/vm/element-deps', 'elements/partitioning-parted/test-elements/many_extended/dib_params', 'elements/bootloader/finalise.d/50-bootloader', 'elements/partitioning-common/lib/partitioning-functions', 'elements/partitioning-parted/element-deps', 'elements/partitioning-sfdisk/block-device.d/10-partitioning-sfdisk', 'elements/partitioning-parted/test-elements/many_extended/element-deps', 'elements/gentoo/test-elements/build-succeeds/element-deps'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/cda78bc33cf37386ad669c6d106bb1091fdbc90f', 'message': "partitioning-parted: extraced and adapted element

Two major reasons for this patch:
o factor out the code duplication of vm/block-device.d and
  partitioning-sfdisk/block-device.d.
  It looks that the later one is a copy&paste&adapt two lines
  of the former.
o Use parted which was already used in the vm/block-device.d as an
  alternative to sfdisk generating user-defined partition tables with
  more than one usable partition.

It was not possible to have only local changes, because of lot of
different elements making assumptions about the partition table, boot
partitions, name of the partitions - e.g. disk-image-create,
bootloader, debootstrap.

One goal was to be as compatible as possible: users of an older version
who does not use the new element should get the same result as
before.

Common used functions are implemented in the 'partitioning-functions'
in the 'partitions-common' element.

The new implemented element and functions prepare using other ways of
providing disk space, e.g. using LVM.

Change-Id: Ib75a021e32fcb2b0a595bae8791f6768cd5babbd
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
"}]
commit_message:
partitioning-parted: extraced and adapted element

Two major reasons for this patch:
o factor out the code duplication of vm/block-device.d and
  partitioning-sfdisk/block-device.d.
  It looks that the later one is a copy&paste&adapt two lines
  of the former.
o Use parted which was already used in the vm/block-device.d as an
  alternative to sfdisk generating user-defined partition tables with
  more than one usable partition.

It was not possible to have only local changes, because of lot of
different elements making assumptions about the partition table, boot
partitions, name of the partitions - e.g. disk-image-create,
bootloader, debootstrap.

One goal was to be as compatible as possible: users of an older version
who does not use the new element should get the same result as
before.

Common used functions are implemented in the 'partitioning-functions'
in the 'partitions-common' element.

The new implemented element and functions prepare using other ways of
providing disk space, e.g. using LVM.

Change-Id: Ib75a021e32fcb2b0a595bae8791f6768cd5babbd
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/38/313938/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: #!/bin/bash if [ ${DIB_DEBUG_TRACE:-0} -gt 0 ]; then set -x fi set -eu set -o pipefail source $_LIB/die [ -n "$IMAGE_BLOCK_DEVICE" ] || die "Image block device not set" # Create 2 partitions for PPC, one for PReP boot and other for root if [[ "$ARCH" =~ "ppc" ]] ; then sudo parted -a optimal -s $IMAGE_BLOCK_DEVICE \ mklabel msdos \ mkpart primary 0 8cyl \ set 1 boot on \ set 1 prep on \ mkpart primary 9cyl 100% else sudo parted -a optimal -s $IMAGE_BLOCK_DEVICE \ mklabel msdos \ mkpart primary 1MiB 100% \ set 1 boot on fi sudo partprobe $IMAGE_BLOCK_DEVICE # To ensure no race conditions exist from calling partprobe sudo udevadm settle # If the partition isn't under /dev/loop*p1, create it with kpartx DM= if [ ! -e "${IMAGE_BLOCK_DEVICE}p1" ]; then DM=${IMAGE_BLOCK_DEVICE/#\/dev/\/dev\/mapper} # If running inside Docker, make our nodes manually, because udev will not be working. if [ -f /.dockerenv ]; then # kpartx cannot run in sync mode in docker. sudo kpartx -av $TMP_IMAGE_PATH sudo dmsetup --noudevsync mknodes else sudo kpartx -asv $TMP_IMAGE_PATH fi elif [[ "$ARCH" =~ "ppc" ]]; then sudo kpartx -asv $TMP_IMAGE_PATH fi if [ -n "$DM" ]; then echo "IMAGE_BLOCK_DEVICE=${DM}p1" elif [[ "$ARCH" =~ "ppc" ]]; then DM=${IMAGE_BLOCK_DEVICE/#\/dev/\/dev\/mapper} echo "IMAGE_BLOCK_DEVICE=${DM}p2" else echo "IMAGE_BLOCK_DEVICE=${IMAGE_BLOCK_DEVICE}p1" fi

commit_message:
remove doc-publisher-site

The publishing system has changed and doc-publisher-site was
removed. Remove the step telling folks to set it so we can avoid
confusion.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Set sysinfo_serial="none" in LibvirtDriverTestCase
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-13 20:46:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e0a8582c8dfe6894bdf9efe9e7c6eda4f637440f', 'message': 'Set sysinfo_serial="none" in LibvirtDriverTestCase

Some tests, like test_rescue was failing when on host was
empty file /etc/machine-id
Setting config option sysinfo_serial to "none" in those tests
disable code which is trying to get host sysinfo serial which
which is not needed in tests and makes unit tests passing in
case when /etc/machine-id is empty.

Change-Id: I5877b313649d9ba52cd28ff4deb849eead0b770f
Closes-Bug: #1640502
'}]
commit_message:
Set sysinfo_serial="none" in LibvirtDriverTestCase

Some tests, like test_rescue was failing when on host was
empty file /etc/machine-id
Setting config option sysinfo_serial to "none" in those tests
disable code which is trying to get host sysinfo serial which
which is not needed in tests and makes unit tests passing in
case when /etc/machine-id is empty.

Change-Id: I5877b313649d9ba52cd28ff4deb849eead0b770f
Closes-Bug: #1640502

added_lines: self.flags(sysinfo_serial="none", group="libvirt")

commit_message:
Improve enabled_*_interfaces config help and validation

This adds additional constraints to the help messages for the
enabled_*_interfaces config options. It also checks if they are
empty at conductor startup, and if any are empty, errors out
with a better error message than previously provided.

Change-Id: I97fc318ce00291d5e43b70423930981c2f5a2de0
Partial-Bug: #1524745

commit_message:
Add back policy check for CG

Policy check has been missing from create/delete CG after the
migration CG code was introduced. This patch adds them back.

commit_message:
Add 'server_create_image' operation for nova driver

The said method will be used to create a snapshot of an existing nova
server. Such a snapshot can be used for server healing without losing
state info in instance.

Change-Id: Ie447ba6798c7d792338de0eb0c8dc275bb2dab9e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/83/426783/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove 'load_all' from cluster_policy module

This removes the 'load_all' method from the cluster_policy module. We
are using the cluster_policy versioned object as an alternative.

Change-Id: I7f1df0441d808341dd50ffa6f20f36ccc1cb54ab

commit_message:
Deprecate the Linux SMBFS driver

We're marking the Linux SMBFS driver as unsupported, completely
removing it during the next release.

We've decided to deprecate it mostly because of its limitations
and lack of demand, unlike the Windows SMB driver which is largely
adopted in Hyper-V deployments.

Our CI will continue to send reports for this driver until it's
completely removed.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1da58e36fc29a4dfee58454cf123543adbc6cac4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/45/420745/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- deprecations: - | The Cinder Linux SMBFS driver is now deprecated and will be removed during the following release. Deployers are encouraged to use the Windows SMBFS driver instead.

This adds a driver for glance v2. We will use this driver for checking
images. Two things to note: 1. glance v1 is deprecating, so there is no
need to add support to it; 2. nova is deprecating its proxy calls to

commit_message:
Driver for glance v2

This adds a driver for glance v2. We will use this driver for checking
images. Two things to note: 1. glance v1 is deprecating, so there is no
need to add support to it; 2. nova is deprecating its proxy calls to
images, networks etc. We are supposed to use the image backend directly
in future when we need to interact with image repos.

Change-Id: Id61304dafe8f7f3e1a7de01136e4b2246e029a20
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/01/426801/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from senlin.drivers.openstack import glance_v2 from senlin.drivers.openstack import sdk from senlin.tests.unit.common import base from senlin.tests.unit.common import utils @mock.patch.object(sdk, 'create_connection') class TestGlanceV2(base.SenlinTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestGlanceV2, self).setUp() self.ctx = utils.dummy_context() self.conn_params = self.ctx.to_dict() self.fake_conn = mock.Mock() self.image = self.fake_conn.image def test_init(self, mock_create): mock_create.return_value = self.fake_conn gc = glance_v2.GlanceClient(self.conn_params) self.assertEqual(self.fake_conn, gc.conn) mock_create.assert_called_once_with(self.conn_params) def test_image_find(self, mock_create): mock_create.return_value = self.fake_conn gc = glance_v2.GlanceClient(self.conn_params) res = gc.image_find('foo') expected = self.image.find_image.return_value self.assertEqual(expected, res) self.image.find_image.assert_called_once_with('foo', True) def test_image_find_ignore_missing(self, mock_create): mock_create.return_value = self.fake_conn gc = glance_v2.GlanceClient(self.conn_params) res = gc.image_find('foo', ignore_missing=False) expected = self.image.find_image.return_value self.assertEqual(expected, res) self.image.find_image.assert_called_once_with('foo', False) def test_image_get(self, mock_create): mock_create.return_value = self.fake_conn gc = glance_v2.GlanceClient(self.conn_params) res = gc.image_get('foo') expected = self.image.get_image.return_value self.assertEqual(expected, res) self.image.get_image.assert_called_once_with('foo')

commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Needed-By: I7a46bbabc1da1c4cf993730bb62b54a638ffbac8
Change-Id: Ia066b7b25f6efeadf87bac0d62f66a9ee4ed1f24
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/32/429032/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash -xe # This script will be run by OpenStack CI before unit tests are run, # it sets up the test system as needed. # Developers should setup their test systems in a similar way. # This setup needs to be run as a user that can run sudo. # The root password for the MySQL database; pass it in via # MYSQL_ROOT_PW. DB_ROOT_PW=${MYSQL_ROOT_PW:-insecure_slave} # This user and its password are used by the tests, if you change it, # your tests might fail. DB_USER=openstack_citest DB_PW=openstack_citest sudo -H mysqladmin -u root password $DB_ROOT_PW # It's best practice to remove anonymous users from the database. If # a anonymous user exists, then it matches first for connections and # other connections from that host will not work. sudo -H mysql -u root -p$DB_ROOT_PW -h localhost -e " DELETE FROM mysql.user WHERE User=''; FLUSH PRIVILEGES; GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON *.* TO '$DB_USER'@'%' identified by '$DB_PW' WITH GRANT OPTION;" # Now create our database. mysql -u $DB_USER -p$DB_PW -h 127.0.0.1 -e " SET default_storage_engine=MYISAM; DROP DATABASE IF EXISTS openstack_citest; CREATE DATABASE openstack_citest CHARACTER SET utf8;" # Same for PostgreSQL # The root password for the PostgreSQL database; pass it in via # POSTGRES_ROOT_PW. DB_ROOT_PW=${POSTGRES_ROOT_PW:-insecure_slave} # Setup user root_roles=$(sudo -H -u postgres psql -t -c " SELECT 'HERE' from pg_roles where rolname='$DB_USER'") if [[ ${root_roles} == *HERE ]];then sudo -H -u postgres psql -c "ALTER ROLE $DB_USER WITH SUPERUSER LOGIN PASSWORD '$DB_PW'" else sudo -H -u postgres psql -c "CREATE ROLE $DB_USER WITH SUPERUSER LOGIN PASSWORD '$DB_PW'" fi # Store password for tests cat << EOF > $HOME/.pgpass *:*:*:$DB_USER:$DB_PW EOF chmod 0600 $HOME/.pgpass # Now create our database psql -h 127.0.0.1 -U $DB_USER -d template1 -c "DROP DATABASE IF EXISTS openstack_citest" createdb -h 127.0.0.1 -U $DB_USER -l C -T template0 -E utf8 openstack_citest

commit_message:
Add initial Zun API documentation

This patch adds the initial Zun API reference
documents and also add the /v1/services API documents.

Change-Id: I5ae6e313bce7d44fc1e42b982b4446123281c8d8
Partial-Implement: blueprint zun-api-doc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/25/427625/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. -*- rst -*- ================== Manage Zun service ================== Show container management service status ======================================== .. rest_method:: GET /v1/services Enables administrative users to view details for all Zun services. Container management service status details include service id, binary, host, report count, creation time, last updated time, health status, and the reason for disabling service. Response Codes -------------- .. rest_status_code:: success status.yaml - 200 .. rest_status_code:: error status.yaml - 401 Response Parameters ------------------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - X-Openstack-Request-Id: request_id - services: services - binary: binary - created_at: created_at - state: state - report_count: report_count - updated_at: updated_at - host: host - disabled_reason: disabled_reason - id: id_s Response Example ---------------- .. literalinclude:: samples/service-get-resp.json :language: javascript

commit_message:
H305 hacking have been deprecated

H305 hacking have been removed since hacking 0.10.
https://github.com/openstack-dev/hacking/blob/master/setup.cfg
test-requirements of networking-ofagent require hacking >=0.10.0,<0.11.
So remove H305 ignore statement
Closes-Bug: #1653598

Change-Id: I1b949dfaa593af616f0671744008e1ef1f67cb25
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ofagent refs/changes/35/416135/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Reduced the complexity of the main() method

The main() method is very large - almost 180 lines,
and McCabe's cyclomatic complexity 26.
(in cinder/cmd/volume_usage_audit.py)
I extracted some of the functionalities into helper functions
to reduce the length and complexity of main().
(results: http://openqa.sed.hu)
Additionally it became more readable as well, without
changing its functionality.

Change-Id: I116ac01ce5a37f28325af10a2573ae53b0734648

commit_message:
Allow passing in infra and mgmt drivers

These drivers are hard coded. This patch removes them and allows
passing them into tacker command.

Change-Id: I365fb73f1183d24f44d5d481582fc0cd9d0dc139
Closes-bug: 1524243

commit_message:
Create a new container when restart a container when necessary

Recreate and start a new container when container parameter is changed
in COPY_ALWAYS strategy.

Change-Id: I1e45c0dc34a93a18b664109823d6fd5b88c331a2
Closes-Bug: #1659799

added_lines: # If the container parameter is changed, try to start a new one. if self.check_container_differs(container): self.start_container() else: self.restart_container()

Enforce context validation for profiles

This patch adds validation to the context property of profiles.

Change-Id: Id02f13295ec9dcf56b68997949416b25c094f35f

commit_message:
Handle TTL invalid packets(l3 proactive app)

Currently, the L3_LOOKUP_TABLE will decrease ttl when route an packet.
This patch will create/reply an ICMP Time exceed message if the ttl
is invalid after Decrement.

Change-Id: Ia5961e11d203fbe0aada2edab77d410b89b4c399
Partially-implements: blueprint traceroute-support

commit_message:
Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if
you receive a YAML document from an untrusted source
such as the Internet. The function yaml.safe_load()
limits this ability to simple Python objects like
integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I9f865703630fa5c51943db9d31784f8fe2431806
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum-dashboard refs/changes/59/429159/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if
you receive a YAML document from an untrusted source
such as the Internet. The function yaml.safe_load()
limits this ability to simple Python objects like
integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

subject: Fix wrong access-rule negative test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-03 15:03:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/ec37b10ec4905bfd5871ebcbd32c21a6b23db1ef', 'message': "Fix wrong access-rule negative test

The test test_add_access_rule_on_share_with_no_host in
manila_tempest_tests.tests.api.test_rules_negative.ShareIpRulesForNFSNegativeTest
expects a share to fail to schedule, and then validates that an access
rule cannot be added. However, the share may
still be 'creating' when the access change is being
attempted.

While the test passes (access rules cannot be added when
the share status isn't 'available'), the intent of that particular
test is to ensure access rules cannot be added when the share has no host.

In the spirit of true black box testing, we should ensure that the
share fails to schedule before attempting this test.

Change-Id: Id150e0ef546ddfd40d97d9b1a54fd8ba23028720
Closes-Bug: #1661421
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-03 17:32:18.000000000', 'files': ['manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_rules_negative.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/ba3088c4ee2415c44673eb0b82e45ed0aa5e7df2', 'message': "Fix wrong access-rule negative test

The test test_add_access_rule_on_share_with_no_host in
manila_tempest_tests.tests.api.test_rules_negative\
       .ShareIpRulesForNFSNegativeTest
expects a share to fail to schedule, and then validates that an
access rule cannot be added. However, the share may
still be 'creating' when the access change is being
attempted.

While the test passes (access rules cannot be added when
the share status isn't 'available'), the intent of that particular
test is to ensure access rules cannot be added when the share has no
host.

This fixes the cleanup error that happens in consequence,
because we don't allow deleting shares that are in
'creating' state.

In the spirit of true black box testing, we should ensure that the

Change-Id: Id150e0ef546ddfd40d97d9b1a54fd8ba23028720
Closes-Bug: #1661421
"}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong access-rule negative test

The test test_add_access_rule_on_share_with_no_host in
manila_tempest_tests.tests.api.test_rules_negative\
       .ShareIpRulesForNFSNegativeTest
expects a share to fail to schedule, and then validates that an
access rule cannot be added. However, the share may
still be 'creating' when the access change is being
attempted.

While the test passes (access rules cannot be added when
the share status isn't 'available'), the intent of that particular
test is to ensure access rules cannot be added when the share has no
host.

This fixes the cleanup error that happens in consequence,
because we don't allow deleting shares that are in
'creating' state.

In the spirit of true black box testing, we should ensure that the
share fails to schedule before attempting this test.

Change-Id: Id150e0ef546ddfd40d97d9b1a54fd8ba23028720
Closes-Bug: #1661421

commit_message:
Reduce the call of nova.servers.list

The function nova.servers.list() will return a huge context in
the large infrastructure. for example, in a infrastructure with
20 hosts and 140 instances, the length of the RESP content is
about 284k bytes.
we should reduce the call of nova.servers.list(), to avoid
increasing the system load.

Change-Id: I75421d7a0ca08831908d881ebb7afbb45bf27ef6
Closes-Bug: #1646727

Update bootstrap and jquery files

Update bootstrap to latest version, which allows us
to move to jQuery 3. jQuery migrate script found no
upgrade issues.

commit_message:
Integrate Senlin resource to Tacker for VDU management

This spec invents a method to manage VDU scaling by using
Senlin resource.

Blueprint: autoscaling-management-with-senlin-resource
Co-auther: xuhaiwei<hai-xu@xr.jp.nec.com>

Change-Id: I83f2a610df7653afa33a90b6d376ee31f80f6852
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker-specs refs/changes/43/352943/23 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tacker/+spec/vnf-components-cluster-support Problem description =================== Here, we want to integrate the Senlin into Tacker to support cluster management of VDUs. This integration can support not just autoscaling but other use cases like high availability, load balancing, placement. Pros of Senlin: it supports cluster management based on defined policies (autoscaling is one of use cases, other use cases can be high availability, load balancing, placement). Policies can be customized at the runtime and attached to any clusters. Senlin provides clear APIs for cluster management (add/delete nodes and attach/detach policies). Proposed changes =================== We support autoscaling for VNF by scaling in and out the VDU First step, we use 'scalable' capabilities in TOSCA simple definition and modify TOSCA Parser and Heat Translator to translate these capabilities into Senlin resources in HOT template. Second step, we develop Senlin infra driver to provide cluster management APIs to Tacker 1. TOSCA Scaling policy model (just an example, other policies could be added for cluster) .. code-block:: yaml topology_template: node_templates: type: Tosca.nodes.nfv.VDU.Tacker capabilities: scalable: properties: min_instances: 2 max_instances: 5 default_instances: 2 properties: image: cirros-0.3.4-x86_64 flavor: m1.tiny requirements: - virtualLink: node: VL1 policies - scaling_out_policy: type: Tosca.policies.cluster targets: [VDU1] properties: type: senlin.policy.scaling-1.0 properties: scaling: event: CLUSTER_SCALE_OUT adjustment: type: CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY number: 1 Heat Translator and TOSCA parser will be modified to translate the TOSCA template into HOT template that include Senlin resources .. code-block:: yaml resources: VDU1: OS::Senlin::Profile properties: type: os.nova.server-1.0 properties: flavor: m1.tiny cluster-VDU1: type: OS::Senlin::Cluster properties: desired_capacity: 2 max_size: 5 min_size: 2 profile: get_resource: VDU1 scaling_out_policy: type: OS::Senlin::Policy properties: bindings: - cluster: get_resource: cluster-VDU1 properties: event: CLUSTER_SCALE_OUT adjustment: type: CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY number: 1 type: senlin.policy.scaling-1.0

commit_message:
Switch to decorators.idempotent_id on identity

So many modules are using test.idempotent_id and this is for
switching to decorators.idempotent_id on identity.

Change-Id: I8c3ad6a3b20c6829c752f9fae5a27bd3e284c1b1
Related-Bug: #1616913

commit_message:
Adds basic logging to the upgrade-non-controller.sh utility

We are using this to upgrade those roles that have the
disable_upgrade_deployment flag set to true. This adds some basic
logging - logfiles generated in the working directory by name/uuid

Change-Id: Id34be6f36a61dd4eb700bf0fe5e31e1c6c1b8186
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/18/427218/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # upgrades workflow. Those roles that have disable_upgrade_deployment set to # true will have had a /root/tripleo_upgrade_node.sh script delivered during # the composable ansible upgrade steps. This tripleo_upgrade_node.sh is then # invoked over ssh by the operator using the simple utility delivered in this # file. See -h for options. echo "Invoke the /root/tripleo_upgrade_node.sh script on roles that have" echo " disable_upgrade_deployment flag set true, as part of the tripleo" echo " upgrade workflow. The tripleo_upgrade_node.sh is delivered when you" echo " execute the composable ansible upgrade steps. This utility is used" echo " by the operator to invoke the tripleo_upgrade_node.sh on a given" echo " named node (by nova name or uuid):" echo echo " Example invocations:" echo echo " upgrade-non-controller.sh --upgrade overcloud-compute-0 " echo echo " You can run on multiple nodes in parallel: " echo " for i in \$(seq 0 2); do " echo " upgrade-non-controller.sh --upgrade overcloud-compute-\$i &" echo " # Remove the '&' above to have these upgrade in sequence" echo " # rather than in parallel."LOGFILE="$SCRIPT_NAME"-"$(date)"-$UPGRADE_NODE$QUERY_NODE function log { echo "`date` $SCRIPT_NAME $1" 2>&1 | tee $LOGFILE ssh $UPGRADE_NODE_USER@$node_ip sudo $UPGRADE_SCRIPT 2>&1 | tee $LOGFILE ssh $UPGRADE_NODE_USER@$node_ip "sudo tail /var/log/yum.log" 2>&1 | tee $LOGFILE
deleted_lines: # tripleo upgrades workflow at [FIXME(marios): update this]. # In short the upgrade scripts are delivered to the non-controller nodes as # part of the automated (heat delivered) controller upgrade. These are then # invoked from this script by the operator. See -h for options. echo "Invoke the tripleo upgrade script on non controller nodes as part of" echo " the tripleo upgrade workflow."function log { echo "`date` $SCRIPT_NAME $1" ssh $UPGRADE_NODE_USER@$node_ip sudo $UPGRADE_SCRIPT ssh $UPGRADE_NODE_USER@$node_ip "sudo tail /var/log/yum.log"

commit_message:
Make get_capabilities look for clusters

Currently get_capabilities accepts only host as a service identifier and
fails when it cannot find a service with such host property. In A/A
deployment, it should accept cluster_name as well, because
get_capabilities addresses backend and not individual host. This commit
fixes this up by making the call seek for available services using both
host and cluster_name properties.

Although it's an API change, it doesn't need a new microversion, because
it falls under "Did we silently fail to do what is asked?" category.

Change-Id: If7bca131c84fc997da8ad277eccd134e8ca4b316
Closes-Bug: 1660990

subject: Fix unit tests error introduced by _get_session
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-03 03:11:08.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/tests/unit/network/test_central_plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/7b1558e854ff4ccfcfe044def3ac6dd8ae3bfbb6', 'message': "Fix unit tests error introduced by _get_session

1. What is the problem
In neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.helpers._get_session, the passed-in
argument is first checked if it's a neutron.context.Context object,
the argument will be directly returned if it's not a neutron Context
object. In our test cases, the FakeNeutronContext does not inherit
neutron Context object, so the session inside FakeNeutronContext is
not returned.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Make FakeNeutronContext inherit neutron Context object. A bump_revision
method is also added to DotDict object since Neutron starts to call
this method.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
No new features

Change-Id: Ib17eb96418088217e991e52501209e0fc1227213
"}]
commit_message:
Fix unit tests error introduced by _get_session

1. What is the problem
In neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.helpers._get_session, the passed-in
argument is first checked if it's a neutron.context.Context object,
the argument will be directly returned if it's not a neutron Context
object. In our test cases, the FakeNeutronContext does not inherit
neutron Context object, so the session inside FakeNeutronContext is
not returned.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Make FakeNeutronContext inherit neutron Context object. A bump_revision
method is also added to DotDict object since Neutron starts to call
this method.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
No new features

Change-Id: Ib17eb96418088217e991e52501209e0fc1227213
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/55/428555/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

As cwd is used to specifiy from which directory we need to run

'}]
commit_message:
Removing cmd from tempest workspace creation

As cwd is used to specifiy from which directory we need to run
the command. Since workspace is created once tempest command is present
and tempest is coming from package and so can be executed from anywhere
from the system otherwise cwd is give error stating directory not found.
so, removing it.

Change-Id: Ia9e48d951e0f37e985e628b7a49401d75c9e4729
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tempest refs/changes/47/428147/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Stop creating a context manager during db._api module import

This patch exposes accessors methods for the context manager,
pulls latest changes according to bp/enginefacade-switch, and
publishes a Sql fixture.

Co-authored-by: Ann Taraday <akamyshnikova@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I6e923e9b228ba20a8b782e787504239da713c652

commit_message:
Renaming of api parameters

Some parameters of similar name would follow the convention
such as `region_id` and `region_id_1` which gave no good
information as to the differences.

This patch changes these names to help give such information.

Change-Id: I2dec61ed06042990ff54e86c02dc3fca9d566366

commit_message:
[Devstack] fix waiting resources on subnode

For multinode setup we enroll IRONIC_VM_COUNT VMs on each of nodes.
As result on subnode we expecting to have 2 * IRONIC_VM_COUNT resources.

Change-Id: I5f939b0e4a8169e27c3b338ed2857efbe7263ecd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/75/427675/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(vsaienko) we enrolling IRONIC_VM_COUNT on each node. So on subnode # we expect to have 2 x total_cpus if [[ "$HOST_TOPOLOGY_ROLE" == 'subnode' ]]; then total_nodes=$(( total_nodes * 2 )) total_cpus=$(( total_cpus * 2 )) fi

commit_message:
Multiple tweaks for Ocata release notes

Those hopefully are of benefit. The major bit of the change is stopping
to use prelude section for all current release notes. This is because
the section is supposed to contain global release notes, not
feature-specific.

Other tweaks are open for debate.

Change-Id: I1d5e46591195a9756ee9fd5276f163794c366528
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/10/429010/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - Middleware was added to parse the ``X-Forwarded-Proto`` HTTP header or the Proxy protocol in order to help Neutron respond with the correct URL references when it's put behind a TLS proxy such as ``haproxy``. This adds ``http_proxy_to_wsgi`` middleware to the pipeline. This middleware is disabled by default, but can be enabled via a configuration option in the ``[oslo_middleware]`` group. upgrade: - The ``api-paste.ini`` configuration file for the paste pipeline was updated to add the ``http_proxy_to_wsgi`` middleware.
deleted_lines: - Middleware was added to parse the X-Forwarded-Proto HTTP header or the Proxy protocol in order to help neutron respond with the correct URL refs when it's put behind a TLS proxy (such as HAProxy). This adds http_proxy_to_wsgi middleware to the pipeline. This middleware is disabled by default, but can be enabled via a configuration option in the oslo_middleware group. upgrade: - The api-paste.ini configuration file for the paste pipeline was updated to add the http_proxy_to_wsgi middleware.

commit_message:
Add additional proxy and config endpoints for UI

Include additional hiera variables in the format of
<scheme>://<host>:<port> suitable for use in both Apache mod_proxy rules
and UI configuration file generation.  Two sets of hiera variables are
created, since they vary slightly depending on the context in which
they're referenced.   This work also includes fixup code for the proper
format of a Websocket URL appropriate for tunnelling wss through https.

Tests were also modified to reflect the current number of endpoints.

This change is required by other work being done to the rest of the
associated blueprint, against the tripleo-puppet repo.

Change-Id: Ib20f4b0891563ae90ec80675635a64c39bd2fdb7

added_lines: /* * (c) Copyright 2017 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. * * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. * You may obtain a copy of the License at * * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 * * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and * limitations under the License. */ (function () { 'use strict'; /* eslint-disable max-len */ /** * @ngdoc overview * @name resources.os-ironic-nodes * @description * * # resources.os-ironic-node * * This module provides OpenStack Ironic Node functionality */ angular.module('resources.os-ironic-nodes', [ ]) .constant('resources.os-ironic-nodes.resourceType', 'OS::Ironic::Node') .run(run) .config(config); run.$inject = [ 'horizon.framework.conf.resource-type-registry.service', 'resources.os-ironic-nodes.basePath', 'resources.os-ironic-nodes.resourceType' ]; function run(registry, basePath, resourceTypeName) { registry.getResourceType(resourceTypeName) .setNames(gettext('Ironic Node'), gettext('Ironic Nodes')) .setSummaryTemplateUrl(basePath + '/summary.html') .setProperty('id', { label: gettext('ID') }) .setProperty('name', { label: gettext('UUID') }) .setProperty('uuid', { label: gettext('UUID') }) .setProperty('name', { label: gettext('Name'), filters: ['noValue'] }) .setProperty('chassis_uuid', { label: gettext('Chassis UUID'), filters: ['noValue'] }) .setProperty('instance_uuid', { label: gettext('Instance UUID'), filters: ['noValue'] }) .setProperty('power_state', { label: gettext('Power State'), values: { 'power off': gettext('Off'), 'power on': gettext('On'), 'rebooting': gettext('Rebooting') } }) .setProperty('target_power_state', { label: gettext('Target Power State'), values: { 'power off': gettext('Off'), 'power on': gettext('On'), 'rebooting': gettext('Rebooting') } }) .setProperty('provision_state', { label: gettext('Provisioning State'), filters: ['noValue'] }) .setProperty('target_provision_state', { label: gettext('Target Provisioning State'), filters: ['noValue'] }) .setProperty('maintenance', { label: gettext('Down for Maintenance?'), values: { true: gettext('Yes'), false: gettext('No') } }) .setProperty('maintenance_reason', { label: gettext('Maintenance Reason'), filters: ['noValue'] }) .setProperty('console_enabled', { label: gettext('Console Enabled?'), values: { true: gettext('Yes'), false: gettext('No') } }) .setProperty('last_error', { label: gettext('Last Error'), filters: ['noValue'] }) .setProperty('network_interface', { label: gettext('Network Interface'), filters: ['noValue'] }); } config.$inject = [ '$provide', '$windowProvider' ]; /** * @name config * @param {Object} $provide * @param {Object} $windowProvider * @description Routes used by this module. * @returns {undefined} Returns nothing */ function config($provide, $windowProvider) { var path = $windowProvider.$get().STATIC_URL + 'resources/os-ironic-nodes'; $provide.constant('resources.os-ironic-nodes.basePath', path); } })();

commit_message:
Create beaker test script

Change-Id: I15cbaa1046f68823f800c76d05300d5ba239ead4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/18/422818/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash -ex # Copyright 2017 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. export WORKSPACE=${WORKSPACE:-`pwd`} export SCRIPT_DIR=$(cd `dirname $0` && pwd -P) export BEAKER_set=${BEAKER_set:-'nodepool-centos7'} export BEAKER_debug=${BEAKER_debug:-yes} export BEAKER_color=${BEAKER_color:-no} export GEM_HOME=${WORKSPACE}/.bundled_gems export NODE=${NODE:-''} # deploy puppet4 on experimental beaker jobs # https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/BKR-821 if [ "${NODE}" == "ubuntu-xenial" ]; then export PUPPET_INSTALL_TYPE=agent export PUPPET_MAJ_VERSION=4 fi # Pull in mirror facter facts source ${SCRIPT_DIR}/mirrors.sh mkdir .bundled_gems gem install bundler --no-rdoc --no-ri --verbose $GEM_HOME/bin/bundle install --retry 3 $GEM_HOME/bin/bundle exec rspec spec/acceptance

commit_message:
Stop setting deprecated enable_setting_ipmi_credentials option

It was deprecated in ironic-inspector and is being deprecated in puppet-ironic.

Change-Id: Ia5658a0a2b77dff6698c7a5b784e95558b8d2d52
Related-Bug: #1654318

commit_message:
api-ref: Correct port binding extension

Also merges port binding extension into the port API.
port binding extension is an attribute extension, so it is natural
if we can see all port attribute in a single page.

Co-Authored-By: Sindhu Devale <sindhu.devale@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-in-tree-api-ref
Change-Id: Ia6b5966e597f3f619222a27f9a1eca03d6ed59b7

commit_message:
roles: bifrost-create-vm-nodes: Randomize VM XML file

/tmp/vm.xml is not that uncommon to exist outside of bifrost and to
hold user's temporary VM definitions so make sure we don't wipe it
and use a random file instead.

Change-Id: I70088df744011b391a66ab2f98b67583c43dd0b2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/16/428716/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local vm_tmpfile=$(mktemp -p /tmp vm.XXXX.xml) # This is very unlikely to happen but still better safe than sorry if [ $? != 0 ]; then echo "Failed to create the temporary VM XML file" exit 1 fi echo ${vm_xml} > ${vm_tmpfile} virsh define ${vm_tmpfile} &>/dev/null rm -f ${vm_tmpfile} rm -f ${vm_tmpfile}

commit_message:
Update psutil version to >= 3.0.1

This bumps the psutil requirement to >= 3.0.1 to match the new upper
constraint in the global requirements [1]. This also removes the local
capping of psutil to version 3.0.1.

Removing the 3.0.1 cap is also necessary to run the agent in
environments using the musl libc, such as Alpine Linux, due to an issue
resolved in more recent releases [2].

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/420837/
[2]: https://github.com/giampaolo/psutil/issues/664

Change-Id: If811db1aeac7cb7b37c710f1ba79568d7beb101f

commit_message:
Run bindep on zuul integration job

We currently don't run install-distro-packages.sh for our experimental
integration job for zuul. As a result, things added to bindep.txt are
not installed.

Change-Id: I19df83a5cabf8bd2c90a1dd54c8ff0e246b6c60b
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/18/429018/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - shell: | #!/bin/bash -xe cd openstack-infra/zuul /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh

commit_message:
Use _create_network in _create_network_structure

Similar to the change in I254dbd166a79ca07e18a61da92bc536b035452e1,
we should be creating individual networks for each call to this method
rather than cramming a bunch of subnets into a single network.

This function is called by the router scenarios, which should be using
their own individual networks to match real deployment topologies.

Change-Id: I032ddc818abe2ac156169b2ed82fc0049319fb9a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/30/428030/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.scenario._create_network = mock.Mock(return_value=network) self.scenario._create_network.assert_called_once_with( network_create_args or {})

commit_message:
Disable batch upgrade deployments for disabled roles

Currently we don't correctly disable the batch_upgrade_tasks, so
rework the loops to ensure we only create the batch deployments
for roles which enabled upgrades.

Note this modifies some loop whitespace too which cleans up the
rendered output and makes it a bit more readable/compact.

Change-Id: I1c257dcc351e99efa54f9cae4b3009287908756e
Partially-Renders: blueprint overcloud-upgrades-per-service

commit_message:
Reduce number of steps for upgrades

We don't need all the steps currently enabled for either batched
or concurrent updates, so decrease them.  In future we can perhaps
introspect the task tags during plan creation and set these
dynamically.

Change-Id: I0358886a332dfbecd03bc4a67086b08d25756c22
Partially-Implements: blueprint overcloud-upgrades-per-service

commit_message:
net-config-multinode: make controlplane int idempotent

When doing a stack-update, it will try to create the control plane
interface again.
Add this conditional so the interface is not created if already exist.

Note: this code has been taken from tripleo-ci and is consistent with
how multinode jobs are currently tested.

Co-Authored-By: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Mathieu Bultel <mbultel@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I773fdf5359cead6961b595e3c8192b02406452b7
Related-Bug: #1661412
(cherry picked from commit f48c66509984a29169a1437593b4e288f1eb506c)

commit_message:
Align the stars

1. Disable Trove on Ubuntu, tempest tests are failing with recent
   packaging. We'll re-enable it later when UCA will update it.

2. Designate: improve resource orchestration.
   Make sure we update Designate pools only when designate-central is
   already started and ready.

Change-Id: Ie9134592934cf691d027e4a47037bacd42d1b05b

subject: Simplify/fix config enabled conditions for upgrades
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-02 18:08:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/45163fc8a8e06372e0406742229197e06f5d9987', 'message': "Simplify/fix config enabled conditions for upgrades

We should enable each kind of upgrade per role, not per step
so rework the conditions, and also only apply it to the deployment
(to save the round-trip to the nodes applying an empty config)
but don't disable the *Config resources as the overhead of these
is small, and we reference the Step1 config in the outputs, even
if it's empty.

commit_message:
Simplify/fix config enabled conditions for upgrades

We should enable each kind of upgrade per role, not per step
so rework the conditions, and also only apply it to the deployment
(to save the round-trip to the nodes applying an empty config)
but don't disable the *Config resources as the overhead of these
is small, and we reference the Step1 config in the outputs, even
if it's empty.

Change-Id: Iee2f1fb5b1d8b0b6001c6ab0f2a4ef2858cef281
Partially-Implements: blueprint overcloud-upgrades-per-service

commit_message:
Configure VNC Server listen address through t-h-t

This adds an entry for libvirt (which is used by the VNC server) on
which we can tell it via t-h-t on which IP address to listen on.

Change-Id: Ie377c09734e9f6170daa519aed69c53fc67c366b
Related-Bug: #1660099

FWaaS v2 Tempest API tests

Add Tempest API tests for FWaaS v2.
Partially-Implements: blueprint fwaas-api-2.0

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 Midokura SARL # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import time from tempest import config from tempest import exceptions from tempest.lib.common.utils import data_utils from tempest.lib.common.utils import test_utils from tempest.lib import exceptions as lib_exc from neutron_fwaas.tests.tempest_plugin.services import v2_client from neutron_lib import constants as nl_constants CONF = config.CONF class FWaaSClientMixin(object): @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): super(FWaaSClientMixin, cls).resource_setup() manager = cls.manager cls.firewall_groups_client = v2_client.FirewallGroupsClient( manager.auth_provider, CONF.network.catalog_type, CONF.network.region or CONF.identity.region, endpoint_type=CONF.network.endpoint_type, build_interval=CONF.network.build_interval, build_timeout=CONF.network.build_timeout, **manager.default_params) cls.firewall_policies_client = v2_client.FirewallPoliciesClient( manager.auth_provider, CONF.network.catalog_type, CONF.network.region or CONF.identity.region, endpoint_type=CONF.network.endpoint_type, build_interval=CONF.network.build_interval, build_timeout=CONF.network.build_timeout, **manager.default_params) cls.firewall_rules_client = v2_client.FirewallRulesClient( manager.auth_provider, CONF.network.catalog_type, CONF.network.region or CONF.identity.region, endpoint_type=CONF.network.endpoint_type, build_interval=CONF.network.build_interval, build_timeout=CONF.network.build_timeout, **manager.default_params) def create_firewall_rule(self, **kwargs): body = self.firewall_rules_client.create_firewall_rule( name=data_utils.rand_name("fw-rule"), **kwargs) fw_rule = body['firewall_rule'] self.addCleanup(test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, self.firewall_rules_client.delete_firewall_rule, fw_rule['id']) return fw_rule def create_firewall_policy(self, **kwargs): body = self.firewall_policies_client.create_firewall_policy( name=data_utils.rand_name("fw-policy"), **kwargs) fw_policy = body['firewall_policy'] self.addCleanup(test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, self.firewall_policies_client.delete_firewall_policy, fw_policy['id']) return fw_policy def create_firewall_group(self, **kwargs): body = self.firewall_groups_client.create_firewall_group( name=data_utils.rand_name("fwg"), **kwargs) fwg = body['firewall_group'] self.addCleanup(test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, self.delete_firewall_and_wait, fwg['id']) return fwg def delete_firewall_group_and_wait(self, firewall_group_id): self.firewall_groups_client.delete_firewall_group(firewall_group_id) self._wait_firewall_group_while(firewall_group_id, [nl_constants.PENDING_DELETE], not_found_ok=True) def _wait_firewall_group_ready(self, firewall_group_id): self._wait_firewall_group_while(firewall_group_id, [nl_constants.PENDING_CREATE, nl_constants.PENDING_UPDATE]) def _wait_firewall_group_while(self, firewall_group_id, statuses, not_found_ok=False): start = int(time.time()) if not_found_ok: expected_exceptions = (lib_exc.NotFound) else: expected_exceptions = () while True: try: fwg = self.firewall_groups_client.show_firewall_group( firewall_group_id) except expected_exceptions: break status = fwg['firewall_group']['status'] if status not in statuses: break if int(time.time()) - start >= self.firewalls_client.build_timeout: msg = ("Firewall Group %(firewall_group)s failed to reach " "non PENDING status (current %(status)s)") % { "firewall_group": firewall_group_id, "status": status, } raise exceptions.TimeoutException(msg) time.sleep(1)

commit_message:
Increase vim password column length

The original size 128 is not enough for tool generated password.
(The saved password is one transferred, which increased the length).

This patch increase the size to 255 which is enough for ansible
uuid password.

Change-Id: I9defd7522c6a243f00cc8edd7047e96c4586c943
Closes-bug: #1657508

networking-odl: add experimental job with new vpnservice with

provider to use.

Revert "devstack: disable metadata for rally"

This reverts commit 9b371fe685032c9ab08fd1e99cf8583a6fbf11b5.

Change-Id: If549d8e646efac9e9e741c10c2a9c98079a9b7b2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/52/411452/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Conventional DHCP agent must provide all metadata when ODL # layer-3 is enabled. The conventional DHCP agent will be forced # to provide metadata for all networks. iniset $Q_DHCP_CONF_FILE DEFAULT force_metadata True
deleted_lines: if [[ -n "${RALLY_SCENARIO}" ]] ; then # NOTE(yamahata): When rally is run, sometimes OOM-killer is triggered # due to too many metadata-ns-proxy. # For now, disable metadata server as rally is API micro baenchmark # # https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1524916 # neutron-ns-metadata-proxy uses ~25MB/router in production # example: from openstack CI log, based on syslog.txt.gz # 189 neutron-ns-metadata-proxy were running when OOM killer # killed javavm of ODL. iniset $Q_DHCP_CONF_FILE DEFAULT enable_isolated_metadata False iniset $Q_DHCP_CONF_FILE DEFAULT enable_metadata_network False iniset $Q_DHCP_CONF_FILE DEFAULT force_metadata False else # Conventional DHCP agent must provide all metadata when ODL # layer-3 is enabled. The conventional DHCP agent will be forced # to provide metadata for all networks. iniset $Q_DHCP_CONF_FILE DEFAULT force_metadata True fi

commit_message:
Add Loki service plugin for optional DB havoc

This adds a service plugin to introduce random delays
and deadlocks to DB operations to make it easier for
us to see that retry decorators are correctly applied
and race conditions are handled.

Change-Id: I8e283c1b53165faee548d26b3560a2c883dfb977

commit_message:
Remove --omit argument in run_tests.sh

The neutron/openstack/common directory had been removed. So in
run_tests.sh, there is no need to use argument
"--omit='neutron/openstack/common'".

Change-Id: I8da67d2c8c11815108c830e0ae593f1382107572

commit_message:
[01/12] NbApi: Use SEND_ALL_TOPIC when topic is omitted

Some models do not have a specific topic for their objects (because they
do not belong to a specific tenant), but it still makes sense to
distribute them. This patch enables the distribution of None-topic
objects resulting from northbound refactor.

Partially-Implements: blueprint refactor-nb-api
Change-Id: I3e5364e12baade924394a4113f620106f500422e

commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Update devref for this.

Needed-By: I58c1d37d620ca058a4c2127e329d8d21b391965f
Change-Id: Id21d3481f7b4929c40c7351e6321d9ba5ad078b8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/94/428994/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash -xe # This script will be run by OpenStack CI before unit tests are run, # it sets up the test system as needed. # Developers should setup their test systems in a similar way. # This setup needs to be run as a user that can run sudo. # The root password for the MySQL database; pass it in via # MYSQL_ROOT_PW. DB_ROOT_PW=${MYSQL_ROOT_PW:-insecure_slave} # This user and its password are used by the tests, if you change it, # your tests might fail. DB_USER=openstack_citest DB_PW=openstack_citest sudo -H mysqladmin -u root password $DB_ROOT_PW # It's best practice to remove anonymous users from the database. If # a anonymous user exists, then it matches first for connections and # other connections from that host will not work. sudo -H mysql -u root -p$DB_ROOT_PW -h localhost -e " DELETE FROM mysql.user WHERE User=''; FLUSH PRIVILEGES; GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON *.* TO '$DB_USER'@'%' identified by '$DB_PW' WITH GRANT OPTION;" # Now create our database. mysql -u $DB_USER -p$DB_PW -h 127.0.0.1 -e " SET default_storage_engine=MYISAM; DROP DATABASE IF EXISTS openstack_citest; CREATE DATABASE openstack_citest CHARACTER SET utf8;" # Same for PostgreSQL # The root password for the PostgreSQL database; pass it in via # POSTGRES_ROOT_PW. DB_ROOT_PW=${POSTGRES_ROOT_PW:-insecure_slave} # Setup user root_roles=$(sudo -H -u postgres psql -t -c " SELECT 'HERE' from pg_roles where rolname='$DB_USER'") if [[ ${root_roles} == *HERE ]];then sudo -H -u postgres psql -c "ALTER ROLE $DB_USER WITH SUPERUSER LOGIN PASSWORD '$DB_PW'" else sudo -H -u postgres psql -c "CREATE ROLE $DB_USER WITH SUPERUSER LOGIN PASSWORD '$DB_PW'" fi # Store password for tests cat << EOF > $HOME/.pgpass *:*:*:$DB_USER:$DB_PW EOF chmod 0600 $HOME/.pgpass # Now create our database psql -h 127.0.0.1 -U $DB_USER -d template1 -c "DROP DATABASE IF EXISTS openstack_citest" createdb -h 127.0.0.1 -U $DB_USER -l C -T template0 -E utf8 openstack_citest

commit_message:
Trivial: improve logging in FSM transition

Logging function name and module where it is located
if exception is raised during fsm transition.
It helps to find out the cause faster.

Change-Id: I2b07333420a53b7c83ea4fd99332b5e444bfc8c1

commit_message:
Update links in documents

commit_message:
Allow duplicate execution of update node DB api method

Before this patch if _do_update_node() sets "instance_uuid" field
it fails on second execution one by one with exception. This
prevents normal usage of DB reconnect method which proposed with
change I61db83637adfd98a5394d1f570f3de4302c93497. Check of
"instance_uuid" moved to manager method.

Change-Id: I2ae84c95cbd1895068dc4bce01bc122abc7345da

commit_message:
devstack: remove trailing - in ODL_GATE_SERVICE_PROVIDER

openstack CI may pass a value with trailing '-' as
ODL_GATE_SERVICE_PROVIDER. Remove trailing '-' before its use.
This patch is needed for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/419230/

Change-Id: Icb8ff1f3731b125074cab23bc4037b4a17607119

commit_message:
Remove datapath parameters in portsec app

In change Ifc5e1a096e39a4ed6a7c54d5d3c53d7db6bff1e2 the datapath
parameter was made redundant. It is never actually used, and is only
passed around between methods as a parameter.

This change removes this parameter. If it is ever needed, it can be
retrieved from the self instance.

Change-Id: I72fd60d93fbbec405e71f1d460c271152fb4543c

subject: Work around deployments with unsupported API services
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-02 20:43:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/bf9adcecaaced95b28455a4890047f519c402bb8', 'message': 'Work around deployments with unsupported API services

If anyone is running nova-api as a WSGI worker under Apache, they
are missing our service framework and thus do not have proper data
available to make decisions based on service versions. Since those
deployments are risking instability anyway, this patch dispenses
with those safety and correctness checks to avoid short-circuiting
to inoperable code paths all the time.

Change-Id: I44b58e88aa32a1dd2f581fdf8ec75d1a043cc01a
Related-Bug: #1661360
'}]
commit_message:
Work around deployments with unsupported API services

If anyone is running nova-api as a WSGI worker under Apache, they
are missing our service framework and thus do not have proper data
available to make decisions based on service versions. Since those
deployments are risking instability anyway, this patch dispenses
with those safety and correctness checks to avoid short-circuiting
to inoperable code paths all the time.

Change-Id: I44b58e88aa32a1dd2f581fdf8ec75d1a043cc01a
Related-Bug: #1661360
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/15/428415/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # process will proceed usually. If we don't have a service version for # the API then we can't make a reasonable decision here, so we just # have to forge ahead. if service_version > 0 and service_version < 15: # service versions. If we don't have a version for API here, we # don't have the data required to make a good decision, so we just # have to assume they're all up-to-date. if (service_version > 0 and service_version < 15) or CONF.cells.enable:

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import ddt import six from tempest.lib import exceptions from ironicclient.tests.functional.osc.v1 import base @ddt.ddt class BaremetalNodeCreateNegativeTests(base.TestCase): """Negative tests for node create command.""" def setUp(self): super(BaremetalNodeCreateNegativeTests, self).setUp() @staticmethod def constuct_cmd(base_cmd, argument, value): cmd = base_cmd if argument: cmd = '{0} {1} {2}'.format(cmd, argument, value) return cmd @ddt.data( ('--uuid', '', 'expected one argument'), ('--uuid', '!@#$^*&%^', 'Expected a UUID'), ('--uuid', '0000 0000', 'unrecognized arguments'), ('--driver-info', '', 'expected one argument'), ('--driver-info', 'some info', 'unrecognized arguments'), ('--property', '', 'expected one argument'), ('--property', 'some property', 'unrecognized arguments'), ('--extra', '', 'expected one argument'), ('--extra', 'some extra', 'unrecognized arguments'), ('--name', '', 'expected one argument'), ('--name', 'some name', 'unrecognized arguments'), ('--network-interface', '', 'expected one argument'), ('--resource-class', '', 'expected one argument')) @ddt.unpack def test_baremetal_node_create(self, argument, value, ex_text): base_cmd = 'baremetal node create --driver fake' command = self.constuct_cmd(base_cmd, argument, value) six.assertRaisesRegex(self, exceptions.CommandFailed, ex_text, self.openstack, command)

commit_message:
[docs] Improve plugins and cli references

* re-use ``make_definition`` function for displaying parameters of plugins.
  Profit: unified view; references to each argument of each plugin.
* Use list in ``make_definition`` function
* fix indention of plugins parameters descriptions

Change-Id: I0b7e567134d36abde313d5538eab99b282f60178

subject: Replace 'filtered' queries with 'bool'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-01 17:35:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/searchlight-ui/commit/0d7a4b0fba83418bcec523a1c33d70da9e06e827', 'message': "Replace 'filtered' queries with 'bool'

Elasticsearch 5 doesn't support the 'filtered' query type, nor the
'or' type. Both have been rolled up into 'bool'.

See
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/5.1/query-dsl-filtered-query.html

commit_message:
Replace 'filtered' queries with 'bool'

Elasticsearch 5 doesn't support the 'filtered' query type, nor the
'or' type. Both have been rolled up into 'bool'.

See
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/5.1/query-dsl-filtered-query.html

Change-Id: Ie5183ff37c30db8e67318480bda5b14c9495abe1
Closes-Bug: #1658179

commit_message:
Release Castellan 0.6.0

Previously, Castellan was an idependently-released
library, with the most recent release being 0.5.0.
This patch intends to add Castellan as a managed
"Release with Intermediaries" project and request
a new stable branch and release 0.6.0 to be created.

Change-Id: I36cf6a386249ca35ee4f4afd26b471d003b48ef1

commit_message:
Do not show chassis_uuid field when it is not specified

Should not see `chassis_uuid` field when `chassis_uuid`
not specified after `--fields` argument.

Change-Id: I3b2fd5380fd5bf5332ae668b45506de3ab54ee4f
Closes-Bug: #1660944

Make error message clear when no supported secret store found

Closes-Bug: #1616179

added_lines: def __init__(self, key_spec): message = u._("Could not find a secret store plugin for generating " "secret with algorithm '{alg}' and bit-length " "'{len}'.").format(alg=key_spec.alg, len=key_spec.bit_length) raise SecretStoreSupportedPluginNotFound(key_spec) raise SecretStoreSupportedPluginNotFound(key_spec)
deleted_lines: def __init__(self, plugin_name=None): message = u._("Secret store plugin not found for requested operation.") raise SecretStoreSupportedPluginNotFound() raise SecretStoreSupportedPluginNotFound()

commit_message:
net-config-multinode: make controlplane int idempotent

When doing a stack-update, it will try to create the control plane
interface again.
Add this conditional so the interface is not created if already exist.

Note: this code has been taken from tripleo-ci and is consistent with
how multinode jobs are currently tested.

Co-Authored-By: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Mathieu Bultel <mbultel@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Added link to modindex

The documentation build does not generate any module index, thus
the link to the page has been added. The page
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/neutron-lbaas-dashboard/py-modindex.html
contains module indexes.

Change-Id: I527e7e56c2997f49fd54f337407d089b6bbf0f57

keystone: Use normal python jobs

anymore, change to the standard python unit jobs.

commit_message:
Revert "set innodb_file_per_table to ON for MySQL / Galera"

This reverts commit 621ea892a299d2029348db2b56fea1338bd41c48.

We're getting performance problems on SATA disks.

Change-Id: I30312fd5ca3405694d57e6a4ff98b490de388b92
Closes-Bug: #1661396
Related-Bug: #1660722
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/35/428435/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: --- features: - Enable innodb_file_per_table for MySQL/MariaDB databases upgrade: - | Newly created MySQL database tables will be stored in their own datafiles, instead of in a single monolithic ibdata file. - | Existing MySQL database tables that are persisted within the monolithic ibdata file will remain so unless the database is migrated as well. - | Migration of all current database tables out of the monolithic ibdata file is possible by dumping and restoring the whole database to a new data directory, however when using Galera the entire cluster must be shut down and upgraded at once. - | Migration of individual tables to datafiles is possible using the MySQL command "ALTER TABLE <databasename>.<tablename> ENGINE=InnoDB;", however this will not shrink the ibdata file and also is not safe to run on a running Galera cluster for large tables.

commit_message:
export OS_BAREMETAL_API_VERSION in stackrc

This patch updates stackrc so that we actually export
the OS_BAREMETAL_API_VERSION that was already getting set in this file.

Closes-Bug: #1661628
Change-Id: I798bff230b56a37e2f19fbf05645a833b623f1c4
(cherry picked from commit 15eb78ede597833c199f7c8dbe4b73f4c9ebf269)

added_lines: export OS_BAREMETAL_API_VERSION

commit_message:
Disable puppet on upgrade for roles not upgrading

Where the role has disabled upgrades, we need to skip both the ansible and
puppet steps.  To do this we refactor the post.j2.yaml so that it can be
included in the upgrade template with an adjusted list of roles.

Note this requires https://review.openstack.org/#/c/425220/ - this
change will be required for local testing of this patch
(run mistral-db-mange populate after updating tripleo-common
and restart the mistral services, or update your repos and re-run
openstack undercloud install).

Partially-Implements: blueprint overcloud-upgrades-per-service
Change-Id: Ie7d0fa6fef3528bd93e6cde076b964ea8de3185a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/05/424905/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% include 'puppet-steps.j2.fragment' %}

{{dep.name}}Deployment_Step{{step -1}} {% endfor %} {% endif %} properties: name: {{role.name}}Deployment_Step{{step}} servers: {get_param: [servers, {{role.name}}]} config: {get_resource: {{role.name}}Config} input_values: step: {{step}} update_identifier: {get_param: DeployIdentifier} {% endfor %} {{role.name}}PostConfig: type: OS::TripleO::Tasks::{{role.name}}PostConfig depends_on: {% for dep in roles %} - commit_message:
Update endpoint api for optional region_id

As per the bug, 'name' and 'nme' are not part of the 'endpoint'
table and were being assigned to the 'extras' column. This is
why they are not being validated.

The endpoint docs also show that `region_id` is not optional, even
though it is. This updates the docs to reflect optional `region_id`.

Closes-Bug: #1579014
Change-Id: I085b75c59767eb96b3bdfe3b887e5e2639122a34
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/85/420085/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - region_id: region_id_1 - extras: extras - extras: extras

subject: Add support for Keepalived VRRP health check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-28 13:45:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/3479e46e5e898b9af9adbef0b73a276bbf48e1a3', 'message': "WIP - Add support for Keepalived health check

Adds functionality to generate bash script which verify health of current
keepalived instance by pinging all available in configuration GW addresess.
This functionality supports IPv4 and IPv6 by detecting needed ping version
using netaddr.

DocImpact:
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_health_health_check' which is by default set for False. Designates is
health check functionality should be enabled. Requires allowed ICMP
ECHO_REQUEST because of that by default disabled.
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_health_check_interval' which will determine the VRRP health check interval
in seconds.

Change-Id: Ib4d0691f432830357ea3f113036719645bc59a62
Closes-Bug: #1365461
Closes-Bug: #1375625

commit_message:
Add support for Keepalived VRRP health check

Adds functionality to generate bash script which verifies health of current
keepalived instance by pinging all available and configured GW addresses.
This functionality supports IPv4 and IPv6 by detecting needed ping version
using netaddr.

DocImpact:
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_vrrp_health_check_interval' which is by default set to 0 (disabled).
Values > 0 designate health check functionality should be enabled.
Requires allowed ICMP ECHO_REQUEST because that is disabled by default.

Co-Authored-By: Artur Korzeniewski <artur.korzeniewski@intel.com>
Change-Id: Ib4d0691f432830357ea3f113036719645bc59a62
Closes-Bug: #1365461
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/46/273546/39 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.BoolOpt('ha_health_check_gateway', default=False, help=_('The VRRP healt check thru pinging GW - require ' 'ICMP ECHO_REQUEST to be enabled')), cfg.IntOpt('ha_health_check_interval', default=5, help=_('The VRRP health check interval in seconds')),

subject: Hitachi VSP: Specify compute nodes and copy ports
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-22 12:27:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/6fa1811db8b107092d40d620a4505356c40d5ee7', 'message': 'Specify the ports for compute nodes and copy functions in Hitachi VSP
drivers

Adds a new config option ``vsp_compute_target_ports`` to specify IDs
of the storage ports used to attach volumes to compute nodes.
Also adds a new config option ``vsp_horcm_pair_target_ports`` to
specify IDs of the storage ports used to copy functions by Hitachi
storage.

commit_message:
Hitachi VSP: Specify compute nodes and copy ports

Adds a new config option ``vsp_compute_target_ports`` to specify IDs
of the storage ports used to attach volumes to compute nodes.
Also adds a new config option ``vsp_horcm_pair_target_ports`` to
specify IDs of the storage ports used to copy functions by Hitachi
storage.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I5b0a8ff08b1faddf38567d8b038a4847d00f2fa7

commit_message:
don't set "export ..." lines in localrc

export lines in localrc end up not matching in devstack-tools for
config file merging. They shouldn't be added that way, as there is no
benefit over just setting them.

Change-Id: I582c262f2280fbaa015bfa7624a129a0f86deac0

commit_message:
Add bulk pull OVO interface

Add an RPC interface to retrieve many OVO resources
at once based on filters.

Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications
Change-Id: I5e765712ab8b8065d71653c563f004c7a9ce9021

added_lines: send-announcements-to: openstack-announce@lists.openstack.org release-notes: http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/octavia/unreleased.html branches: - name: stable/ocata location: 0.10.0 releases: - version: 0.10.0 diff-start: 0.9.0 projects: - repo: openstack/octavia hash: c3345e46573cb6c618cb9447fade2e255b6f5589 highlights: |- * Added support for CentOS, Fedora, RHEL amphora images * Added oslo policy support to octavia v1 API * Added quota support to octavia v1 API * Amphora is now using python 3.5 by default * Adds distribution ID option to diskimage-create.sh * Enable IPv6 for the load balancer management network * Added support for systemd based amphora images * Add a new octavia v1 API to list loadbalancer statistics * Add MTU configuraion when plugging vip or network * Update listener stats to include error count * Add support for PKCS7 bundles and encrypted keys

commit_message:
Fix HNAS driver inconsistent exceptions

Fix following scenarios:

- Driver raises ProcessExecutionError
- Driver serializes the exception and passes to LOG.exception
- Driver does not handle several commands possible failure
- Driver does not log some error situations

Also, slightly improvements with regards to affected tests:

- Improved coverage
- Improved resource names passed to exception messages

Change-Id: I7fd9945d4cd6953e6fb33020d44f2d4472da27c7
Closes-bug: #1660952

commit_message:
HNAS: Fix syntax to make shares read-only in snapshot create

Fixing driver syntax to make NFS shares read-only while snapshots
are being taken. Read/Write permission in HNAS can be added in 3
ways: rw, readwrite and read_write, all of them should be handled
by the driver.

Change-Id: Ib9ba3c1717c8000a5393ea7b8d731d66f7237b2e
Closes-Bug: #1661271

commit_message:
Spec for retrieving NUMA node information

Proposing a spec for retrieving NUMA node information during introspection.

Partial-Bug: #1635253

Co-Authored-By: Saravanan KR <skramaja@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I99aa9f0462f45a1cccec72801fbd14d1395b6386
Signed-off-by: karthik s <ksundara@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector-specs refs/changes/47/396147/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =============================== Retrieve NUMA node information =============================== https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic-python-agent/+bug/1635253 Today, The introspected data from the nodes does not provide information about the NUMA topology to the deployer. The deployer needs information on the associvity of NUMA nodes with the list of cores and NICs. These details would be useful when configuring the nodes with DPDK aware NICs. Problem description =================== Inorder to configure the nodes for better performance, selection of CPUs based on the NUMA topology becomes important. In case of nodes with DPDK aware NICs, the CPUs for poll mode driver (PMD) needs to be selected from the NUMA node associated with the DPDK NICs. If hyperthreading is enabled, then selection of the logical cores requires the knowledge on the siblings. Identifying these information shall help the deployer to configure the system for better performance. Proposed change =============== The class HardwareManager shall be used to fetch the required infomration related to NUMA nodes and sibling threads. * List of logical cores associated with each NUMA node - It shall be fetched by running the "lscpu" utility. Today during the introspection, most of the data provided by “lscpu” is logged, and the CPU list for each NUMA node needs to be included. The modified data structure for { "inventory": { "cpu_topology": { "numa_nodes": { "numa_node_0": [<list of CPUs in NUMA node 0>], "numa_node_1": [<list of CPUs in NUMA node 1>] }, ... } } } Example: { "inventory": { "cpu_topology": { "numa_nodes": { "numa_node_0": [0,1,2,3], "numa_node_1": [4,5,6,7] }, ... } } } * Siblings list for logical cores. It shall be extracted from /sys/devices/system/cpu/cpu<n>/topology/thread_siblings_list for all logical cores The modified data structure shall be { "inventory": { "cpu_topology": { "sibling": [ [ <first set of sibling threads>], [ <2nd set of siblings> ], ... ], ... } } } Example: { "inventory": { "cpu_topology": { "sibling": [ [0,1], [2,3], [4,5], [6,7] ], ... } } } * NUMA node number for PCI device (Network Interfaces) - Extract the numa node for the PCI devices from /sys/bus/pci/devices/<PCI address>/numa_node This is being handled by RFE https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic-python- agent/+bug/1622940 Alternatives ------------ Other options like fetching and displaying these information during the deployment were considered, but it will be too late for the deployer to make an attempt to correct the parameters. HTTP API impact --------------- None Client (CLI) impact ------------------- None Ironic python agent impact -------------------------- The changes discussed above will be fetched using IPA. Performance and scalability impact ---------------------------------- None. Security impact --------------- None Deployer impact --------------- The deployer will be able to get the NUMA topology and the Sibling threads. These information could be useful in configuring the system for better performance. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- karthiks skramaja Work Items ---------- * Fetch list of logical cores associated with each NUMA node * Fetch siblings list for logical cores Dependencies ============ - One section of this spec is being implemented as part of the RFE https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic-python-agent/+bug/1622940 Testing ======= Unit test cases will be added. References ========== [1] http://dpdk.org/doc/guides-16.04/linux_gsg/nic_perf_intel_platform.html

commit_message:
Fix grenade runs which don't use tempest

A bug was reported for a grenade job that doesn't use tempest. Fix is to
check for existence of tempest.conf file before copying it.

Change-Id: I3a79347c8d5b84ea756e7571d0216384fbf2a05e
Closes-Bug: #1651767
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/38/413738/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # Use the same config to target smoke tests. cp $BASE_RELEASE_DIR/tempest/etc/tempest.conf $TARGET_RELEASE_DIR/tempest/etc/tempest.conf

commit_message:
Making is_ubuntu func available to fetch_devstacks

When the fetch_devstacks function runs as part of grenade.sh
it tries to install devstack tools. As part of the devstack tools
installation, python3 gets installed through a function called
install_python3 which uses a function called is_ubuntu to
determine if the system is ubuntu. However this is_ubuntu
function is not available at that moment, so the script fails.

This commit sources functions-common from the devstack directory
which includes is_ubuntu so the grenade.sh script does not break.

Change-Id: I92b9f731e99df0840be296bfa8ce6a70e02a1f91
Closes-bug: 1659081
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/07/424807/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: source $TARGET_DEVSTACK_DIR/functions-common # if devstack.local.conf exists append it to localrc
deleted_lines: # if devstack.local.conf exists append it to locarc
